popularityCurve.label: priestly ordination in the catholic church from the beginning has always been reserved to men alone

clusterList.phrase: priestly ordination in the catholic church from the beginning has always been reserved to men alone

the orthodox are divided up into nineteen traditions the roman catholics have sixteen and the protestants have twenty-one if we throw the anglicans in they account for another six far from bedlam this appears to be simply the cost of the gospel doing business in a fallen world but whichever door you choose you have lots of work for private judgment to do in following up that choice
very few differences could be found between any group of christians and any group of non-christians

christians who believe in and are baptized in the name of the triune god-father son and holy spirit-are conjoined in a deep supernatural union but they still fall short of the full visible unity that christ wills for his church
